page.title: 18MICKLETHWAITE (Continued)
page.content: and other jewellery by Carol Atkinson Some of the houses in Micklethwaite were built in 16O1.The windows were made in tudor times at the begining of the sixteenth century.Two of the three houses still have the original lantern above the windows on the ground floor. There is a stone ledge,the dripstone above all the windows this was to stop the rain leaving streaks on the windows also to stop the noise of the rain.Most of Micklethwaite is farmland the houses all look down onto farmland. BY HELEN GRAHAM,MELANIE FAWELL ,LOUISE SMALL,SUSAN ORMONDROYD.
